requests_custom package

requests_custom.requests_custom module

Module to work with custom requests capabilities.

Python 3 >= 3.6

class requests_custom.requests_custom.RequestsCustom(debug_simple=False, debug_full=False)

Bases: object

Apply desired modifications to the module requests.

Current capabilities configured:

  • Custom timeout for all requests.

  • Raise exception with certain HTTP status code responses.

  • Retry on failure.

BACKOFF_FACTOR

Seconds to sleep between failed request, after the second try, see _get_backoff function.

Type:

int

debug_full

Activate debug the entire HTTP lifecycle.

Type:

bool

debug_simple

Debug the requests with less information, see _set_debug_simple().

Type:

bool

METHOD_WHITELIST

HTTP methods to retry on. POST not included by default.

Type:

list of strs

RETRY_ATTEMPTS

Total number of retry attempts to make.

Type:

int

STATUS_FORCELIST

HTTP response codes to retry on.

TIMEOUT_DEFAULT

Timeout to use at all requests. Seconds.

Type:

int or float

Parameters:

  • debug_simple – See the attribute with the same name.

  • debug_full – See the attribute with the same name.

get_requests()

Get custom request object.

Return type:

request object

class requests_custom.requests_custom.TimeoutHTTPAdapter(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: HTTPAdapter

Setting default timeouts.

TIMEOUT_DEFAULT

Timeout to use at all requests. Seconds.

Type:

int or float

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

TIMEOUT_DEFAULT = 5
send(request, **kwargs)

Use timeout at the requests.

Overrides send() method to use the default timeout if no other provided.

Parameters:

  • request –

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
